items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Natural Gas Prices Leap Higher As Winter’s Not Done
items.summary: Physical natural gas prices surged broadly as another round of cold air and rebounding LNG feed gas flows tightened balances in the eastern half of the country.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Extends Gains on Weather Risks, Looming Outsized Storage Draw
items.summary: Natural gas futures pushed higher for a second session Wednesday as traders priced in a potential record storage draw Thursday and lingering late-winter weather risks that could further tighten balances.

items.title: Near-Record Alberta Storage, Total Supply Stall Western Canada Natural Gas Prices
items.summary: Robust supply and choppy demand continue to keep benchmark Western Canada natural gas prices in check.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Cash Gas Climbs on Cold Weather Return; Henry Hub Gets Added Boost Amid LNG Constraints
items.summary: Cash prices were mostly higher through midday Wednesday as another round of Arctic cold boosted demand, while Henry Hub surged with additional support from expected LNG feed gas slowdowns tied to pipeline maintenance.

items.title: Are Physical Natural Gas Buyers Willing to Pay a Higher Henry Hub Basis Price? Winter Storm Fern Provides Clues
items.summary: The recently concluded February 2026 bidweek was among the most volatile trading periods since the advent of the CME/Nymex Henry Hub futures contract in 1990.

items.title: Tetco Work Could Limit Freeport LNG Feed Gas, Further Limiting U.S. Flows in February
items.summary: Maintenance announced for a stretch of the Texas Eastern Transmission LP (Tetco) pipeline system could further impact U.S. feed gas deliveries this month.

items.title: Cameron Parish Pipeline Fire Linked to Delfin LNG Project, One Injured
items.summary: Louisiana state police are investigating the cause of a pipeline explosion in Cameron Parish reportedly connected to infrastructure for the proposed Delfin LNG project.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Exports to U.S. Drop, Tempering Central Canadian Natural Gas Spot Prices
items.summary: After surging into the double-digits amid a Lower 48 January deep freeze, prices at key natural gas hubs that connect Canadian exports to the Upper Midwest pulled back dramatically this week as winter weather eased and cross-border activity slowed.

items.title: Texas LNG Organizes Financing, Advances Toward FID Later This Year
items.summary: A unit of Glenfarne Group LLC has inked a preliminary agreement with a consortium of lenders to organize a financial package of more than $5.7 billion in funding for its Texas LNG project.

items.title: Epstein Eyed Nigerian Oil Trade, But Feared Being Defrauded
items.summary: Jeffrey Epstein's dark web of global dealings is known to have stretched far and wide, with the disgraced and deceased American tycoon now infamous for having used his network to engage in various high-stakes, often secretive, financial, and politica

items.title: U.S. Power Boom Triggers Global Gas Turbine Shortage
items.summary: The hyperscaler-driven surge in U.S. power demand is creating ripple effects in the global supply chain, with gas turbines becoming the most critical bottleneck to rolling out flexible baseload capacity to support accelerated load growth.    Gas turb

items.title: Russia Leans on China as U.S. Tries to Squeeze Indian Oil Trade
items.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping held a video link call on Wednesday, wherein Putin hailed Russia's energy relationship with China as "strategic" while emphasizing that Beijing has become Moscow's top buyer of oil and

items.title: Mexico’s Pemex Vows To Continue Oil Exports To Cuba Amid Trump Threats
items.summary: Mexico’s National Oil Company Pemex has announced that it intends to uphold its oil supply contract with Cuba despite growing pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump that Mexico distance itself from Cuba, Reuters reported on Wednesday. According to

items.title: Azerbaijan Breaks Ground on Power Line Linking the Caspian to Europe
items.summary: Azerbaijan’s power transmission grid operator AzerEnergy, has begun construction of Azerbaijan’s sections of a planned line that ultimately can connect Azerbaijan and Europe via the TRIPP corridor and Turkey.  The power line received a green light un

items.title: Uniper Shrugs Off Europe’s Growing Reliance on American LNG
items.summary: Uniper is not concerned that Europe now gets more than half of its LNG supply from the United States, as it is the most economical solution while buyers seek to diversify imports from other global providers, according to Carsten Poppinga, the German
